Posts.Title: At last

Posts.Content: ten years ago my sister was diagnosed with breast cancer and had masectomy...and akthoughmum died 6 months after she was diagnosed she could tell mum. Two years ago I had iffy scan but Dad was in hospital up north and dying. I spent the results waiting time trying to figre out how I would tell him and releived it tred out to be fatty tissue. Now the first thing I felt when I was diagnosed in January was that I missed Mum. Now I miss dad as well..as we could laugh at stupid things. This thing gets in your head and no matter how much you push it down and get on with life it will keep bobbing its head above the water.  It has taken over..I cant go to work....my friends all work..I havent a big social group..moved too many times for that...I just want somebody to realise I need a hug  even when I dont think I do. I know there are drop in centres but arranging transport for appointments is hard enough. I am waiting for the cafe in the village to be opened jst for somewhere to go in day . You arent stupid and the treatment wasnt as bad as I thought..had first chemo last week. Its gonna be a hard slog but you can do it.
Posts.Title: I want my mum n dad

Posts.Content: Hi Kate I had CT scan as well and showed something on my remaining ovary. Ive been told nothing to worry about as its slow growing cyst on my remaining ovary ( I had one one my other ovary that grew quite quickly) . I didnt have masectomy but 10 lymph nodes were infected which was more than thougt and lump in breast had grown about 1cm in a month but they managed to clear that without having to have a masectomy.  I have been told to arrange another scan between 6-12 months with GP. I am hoping that it doesnt grow as quick as the other one, I wish you well but its worrying all the waiting

Posts.Content: Biopsy last MOnday, results FRiday, discussing Chemo/Surgery Monday.. Cancer in breast and lymph under arm...will have axillary and wide excision. Put a spanner in works as I have ME and at minute its relatively under control and would recover from surgery better. Chemo for 4 months would have effect o ME ( Biopsies Monday put me in bed for 2 days  after Tuesday..doesnt kick in striaght away) side effects of Chemo are same as ME...low immune, tiredness although its exhaustion with ME...so now having CAY Scan friday..results next Friday jopefully hopefully they then will make another appointment with surgeon ..so everything on hold for at least a week,,,,meanwhile going into work just to kepp semblance of normality and not much else to do until decision is made and keeping fingers crossed dont get any colds etc ( work in special school always things going round ) Its all kicked in so quickly but at same time mothing happening and too much time to think

Posts.Title: Pain in back of hand and wrist

Posts.Content: I applied fro DLA last year as l athough I work I have ME and frequently rely on friends for lifts and due to the illness have had to cut my working days down.. I have been advised to cut down further or give up work ...financially this is not viable. The DLA last year agreed I was bad but not bad enough to claim DLA under their criteria. The fact that I frequently need lifts to work is just hard luck as other days I can drive. I work as TA in special school but have had to change my work to adjust to my conditions.  After being diagnosed with breast cancer in January  I decided that I would try for PIP as I am finding it difficult to cope with both issues. I am still waiting to hear from them but hold out no hope of getting any financial assistance. I rely on friends to give me lifts to hospital as I cannot walk from house to train station or from train station to hospital. Taxis would cost £20 each way and I can get village car run but again its £7 each trip. I dont want the higher amount PIP but the lower mobility would certainly help with the cost of travel. Luckily because of my walking problems and the fact that tiredness is sudden ( for those who find it difficult to cope wit the cemo exhaustion that is what I live with every day) I have a blue badge ...otherwise parking charges at hospital would be phenomenal. I was admitted a couple of weeks ago and it cost my husband nearly £18 in parking. I spoke to macmillan financial help and they agreed that it was unlikely that I would get PIP. You have to have illness for at least 3 months and treatment must be continuing for 9 months. Thats why breast cancer doesnt count. With all the ops treatment etc it will have finished within 8 months..my ME however Ive had for 6 years and is not improving. I am aiming to be back at work in September.....it would be nice to step back and take a breather as this whole year seems to consist of hospital appointments and meds routines but financially I have no choice. I am lcky in that I ave good friend who does all the trips with me as my husband used his compassionate leave at the beginning and  has used his holiday leave whe things have gone a bit haywire and Ive been admitted. If he takes time off work now it is unpaid and we cant afford that.

Posts.Title: Has anyone tried to get PIP

Posts.Content: HI I had lumpectomy and nodes removed at beginning of February. I had 10 of 29 nodes infected which was considered high. I chose to have operation first before chemo because of other health issues. Next week I have my third chemo.  First time you go to chemo the take weight, bloods, height etc and then everything was explained to me as to why I needed chemo and side effects I might get. Must admit first chemo was scary more than anything but side effects were bearable just ( though first thing I went off was tea). Second chemo was not good experience and side effects are more noticeable. Exhaustion is hard work ( and I have ME so am used to exhaustion). Also make sure you have some sort of social life....I find the isolation hard work as my friends are work colleagues and I cant just hop on bus ..also I have give up driving because of the effects chemo is having on my ME. Everybody says you will get through it and you do but just occasionally during treatment you do wonder if you have strength. I am lucky as I have friend who goes with me to every appointment...she knows my ME and gives support when I find it difficult to explain..she also acts as reminder as I dont always pick up what doctors are saying. The one thing I did find helpful ( I am light/touch sensitive on bad days) was to take sunglasses with me to the chemo department as I found the full on flourescent lights extremely tiring. I hope everything goes well for you. By the way I still have the pencil line from my op but at least the arrows have gone.

Posts.Content: I had my WLE and lymph nodes out on Tuesday afternoon. Apparently the lump in my breast was deep so they had good root around. Kept  me in overnight as was exhausted with OP and ME. Oxygen levels kept dropping. Back yesterday with drain in which district nurse was going to deal with today. At about 7.30 noticed top was wet. Couldnt get hold of anybody so rang A & E whos aid to speak to GP..when finally got hold of GP they said they couldnt do anything bt gave me district nurses number..chnaged top again twice. District nurse cam drain was still in place but not going into bottle. In end she spoke to hospital and they said to come straight up.  Drainage had doubled over night with measurment in bottle let alone outside. Drain had apparently slighty come out so bottle had no vacuum..couldnt get dtain in again so now have to go back on Monday for drain by syringe unless I have problem over weekend in which case go straight to A & E. I am tired and very weepy. Cant fid anywhere to put arm in comfort. Shoulder is number but itchy which is a weird feeling altogether. Just generally fed up now.
